intro: Blepharis swaziensis, commonly known as the Swazi sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Blepharis swaziensis is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
